text.0: put forth like a widespreading net thy vigour go like a mighty king with his attendants.
text.1: thou following thy swift net shootest arrows transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely.
text.2: forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons follow them closely glowing in thy fury.
text.3: spread with thy tongue the winged flames o agni unfettered cast thy firebrands all around thee.
text.4: send thy spies forward fleetest in thy motion be neer deceived the guardian of this people.
text.5: from him who near or far is bent on evil and let no trouble sent from thee oercome us.
text.6: rise up o agni spread thee out before us burn down our foes thou who hast sharpened arrows.
text.7: him blazing agni who hath worked us mischief consume thou utterly like driedup stubble.
text.8: rise agni drive off those who fight against us make manifest thine own celestial vigour.
text.9: slacken the strong bows of the demondriven destroy our foemen whether kin or stranger.
text.10: most youthful god he knoweth well thy favour who gave an impulse to this high devotion.
text.11: all fair days and magnificence of riches hast thou beamed forth upon the good mans portals.
text.12: blest agni be the man the liberal giver who with his lauds and regular oblation.
text.13: is fain to please thee for his life and dwelling may all his days be bright be this his longing.
text.14: i praise thy gracious favour sing in answer may this my song sing like a loved one with thee.
text.15: lords of good steeds and cars may we adorn thee and day by day vouchsafe thou us dominion.
text.16: here of free choice let each one serve thee richly resplendent day by day at eve and morning.
text.17: so may we honour thee content and joyous passing beyond the glories of the people.
text.18: whoso with good steeds and fine gold o agni comes nigh thee on a car laden with treasure.
text.19: his friend art thou yea thou art his protector whose joy it is to entertain thee duly.
text.20: through words and kinship i destroy the mighty this power i have from gotama my father.
text.21: mark thou this speech of ours o thou most youthful friend of the house exceeding wise invoker.
text.22: knowing no slumber speedy and propitious alert and ever friendly most unwearied.
text.23: may thy protecting powers unerring agni taking their places here combined preserve us.
text.24: thy guardian rays o agni when they saw him preserved blind māmateya from affliction.
text.25: lord of all riches he preserved the pious the fees who fain would harm them did no mischief.
text.26: aided by thee with thee may we be wealthy may we gain strength with thee to guide us onward.
text.27: fulfil the words of both o ever truthful straightway do this thou god whom power emboldens.
text.28: o agni with this fuel will we serve thee accept the laud we sing to thee with favour.
text.29: destroy the cursing rākṣasas preserve us o rich in friends from guile and scorn and slander.
